article.headline: Lubbock Christian 89, Bradley 81
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Mario Muzurovic scored 23 points and made six 3-pointers as he led Lubbock Christian to an 89-81 victory over Bradley in the the third round of the NCAA Las Vegas Tournament Tuesday. Muzurovic made four of his 3-pointers in the second half including a go-ahead three-point basket with 7:49 left that gave the Chaparrals the lead for good. Lubbock Christian (4-2) made 50 percent of its 3-pointers (6-for-12) and 56 percent of its field goals (14-for-25) during the second half. Brandon Jones had 22 points, Jared Fears scored 16 and Matt Rawls had 13 for the Chaparrals. Marcellus Sommerville led Bradley (2-1) with 28 points while James Gillingham had 17 and Marcello Robinson had 14. The Braves scored the final nine points of the first half to tie the score at 32-32. Sommerville had seven of those points and scored 12 of his 14 first-half points during the last 2:27.
